title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.85 - Use of terminal by charter buses permitted; restrictions; fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.85 - Use of terminal by charter buses permitted; restrictions; fees

State Regulations

Operators of charter bus transportation service between
the City of New York and points outside the city who have not entered into
agreements for space and services at the Port Authority bus terminal will be
permitted to use the enclosed vehicular levels of the terminal, such use to be
limited to one-way and through operations originating at points outside New

York City, and to round-trip operations, the initial portions of which
originate at points outside New York City, the charge for each bus arrival or
departure with passengers to be five dollars. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1220.85

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
